conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the given velocity-time graph and understand how the slopes of the tangents to these curves change over time. The slope of the tangent at any point on the velocity-time graph represents the instantaneous acceleration.
The curve for Car A starts from v1 at t = 0 and increases until it reaches v2 at t = t1.
The curve for Car B starts from v2 at t = 0 and decreases until it reaches v1 at t = t1.

premise: The slope of the tangent line at any point on the curve represents its acceleration. The curve for Car A is concave down.
conclusion: The slope of the tangent line decreases as time progresses for Car A, indicating that the acceleration of Car A is decreasing over time.

premise: The slope of the tangent line at any point on the curve represents its acceleration. The curve for Car B is concave up.
conclusion: The slope of the tangent line increases as time progresses for Car B, indicating that the acceleration of Car B is increasing over time.
In the second diagram, the red lines represent tangents at different points on the curves.

premise: For Car A, the slope of the tangents becomes less steep as time progresses.
conclusion: This confirms a decreasing acceleration for Car A.

premise: For Car B, the slope of the tangents becomes steeper as time progresses.
conclusion: This confirms an increasing acceleration for Car B.

premise: Based on the analysis of the velocity-time graph and the slopes of the tangents.
conclusion: The magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
